pages.text: The dominance type of a morph determines how many alleles are needed for a python to have the morph, and whether or not homozygosity affects the appearance of the python.

pages.title: Dominant
pages.text: Only 1 copy of an allele is required for a python to have the morph. Heterozygous and homozygous pythons look identical.

pages.title: Incomplete Dominant
pages.text: Only 1 copy of an allele is required for a python to have the morph, but homozygous pythons exhibit a distinct 'super form'.

pages.title: Recessive
pages.text: 2 alleles are required for a python to have the morph. Pythons that are heterozygous look identical to those that lack the genes for the morph entirely.
